intro: Clidemia siapensis, commonly known as the Siapan mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine, velvety pubescence. Clidemia siapensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests.
